items.sentence: When I got out of jail, I had no intention of committing another crime.
You know as well as I do that there\'s no chance that Tom will do that.
I think I have just about enough money to buy the computer that I want.
I wonder whether or not Tom has already told Mary she needs to do that.
Tom drinks several cups of coffee every morning before he goes to work.
Tom dropped a cup on the floor and it shattered into a thousand pieces.
Tom figured it would take him a full day to finish painting the garage.
Tom gave up running for mayor after pleading guilty to drunken driving.
Tom had always wanted to study French and he finally got his chance to.
I think Tom didn\'t want to hang out with you guys two nights in a row.
I told Tom that he shouldn\'t cross the road without looking both ways.
Tom didn\'t have as much trouble getting a loan as he thought he would.
I can\'t think of anything I\'d rather do than go on a picnic with you.
Aunt Mary is my mother\'s sister and Aunt Alice is my father\'s sister.
It\'s hard to believe Tom wasn\'t aware that Mary was in love with him.
I used to visit my grandparents several times a month when I was a kid.
Tom took one look at the teacher\'s face and he knew he was in trouble.
Tom usually wears a cowboy hat, but today he\'s wearing a baseball cap.
If you don\'t do this now, you\'ll regret it for the rest of your life.
Tom was able to buy the same computer I bought much cheaper than I was.
